short_description: This function estimates the word allocation according to given set.
long_description: This function is used to estimate the word allocation for each topic and topic distribution for each document according to a specified training set.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table or view that contains the new documents.
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table or view that contains the new documents.

output_tables.name: ModelTable
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name for the model table that the function creates in the database. This table must not already exist.
output_tables.description: Specify the name for the model table that the function creates in the database. This table must not already exist.

output_tables.name: OutputTable
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the output table that contains the topic distribution of eachdocument in the input table, which the function creates in the database. This table must not already exist. If you omit this argument, the function does not generate this table.
output_tables.description: Specify the name of the output table that contains the topic distribution of each document in the input table, which the function creates in the database. This table must not already exist. If you omit this argument, the function does not create this table.

argument_clauses.name: DocIDColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the document identifiers.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input column that contains the document identifiers.

argument_clauses.name: WordColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the words (one word in each row).
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input column that contains the words (one word in each row).

argument_clauses.name: CountColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the count of the corresponding word in the row, a NUMERIC value.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input column that contains the count of the corresponding word in the row, a positive value. Default behavior: The count of each word is 1.

argument_clauses.name: TopicNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of topics for all the documents in the input table, an INTEGER value in the range [2, 1000].
argument_clauses.description: Specify the number of topics for all the documents in the input table, an INTEGER value in the range [2, 1000].

argument_clauses.name: Alpha
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies a hyperparameter of the model, the prior smooth parameter for the topic distribution over documents.As alpha decreases, fewer topics are associated with each document. The default value is 0.1.
argument_clauses.description: Specify a hyperparameter of the model, the prior smooth parameter for the topic distribution over documents. As alpha decreases, fewer topics are associated with each document. Default: 0.1

argument_clauses.name: Eta
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies a hyperparameter of the model, the prior smooth parameter for the word distribution over topics.As eta decreases, fewer words are associated with each topic.The default value is 0.1.
argument_clauses.description: Specify a hyperparameter of the model, the prior smooth parameter for the word distribution over topics. As eta decreases, fewer words are associated with each topic. Default: 0.1

argument_clauses.name: MaxIterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum number of iterations to perform if the model does not converge, a positive INTEGER value. The default value is 50.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the maximum number of iterations to perform if the model does not converge, a positive INTEGER value. Default: 50

argument_clauses.name: ConvergenceDelta
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the convergence delta of log perplexity, a NUMERIC value in the range [0.0,1.0]. The default value is 1e-4.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the convergence delta of log perplexity, a NUMERIC value in the range [0.0, 1.0]. Default: 1e -4

argument_clauses.name: Seed
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the seed with which to initialize the model, a LONG value. Given the same seed, cluster configuration, and input table, the function generates the same model. By default, the function initializes the model randomly.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the random seed the algorithm uses for repeatable results (for more information, see Nondeterministic Results). The seed must be a LONG value.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTopicNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of top-weighted topics and their weights to include in the output table for each training document. The value topics must be a positive INTEGER. The default value, 'all', specifies all topics and their weights.
argument_clauses.description: Ignored unless OutputTable is specified. Specify the number of top-weighted topics to include, with their weights, in the output table for each training document: Option Description 'all' (Default) All topics and their weights. num_topics Positive integer.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTopicWordNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of top topic words and their topic identifiers to include in the output table for each training document. The value topic_words must be a positive INTEGER. The value 'all' specifies all topic words and their topic identifiers. The default value, 'none', specifies no topic words or topic identifiers.
argument_clauses.description: Ignored unless OutputTable is specified. Specify the number of top topic words to include, with their topic identifiers, in the output table for each training document: Option Description 'none' (Default) No topic words or identifiers. 'all' All topic words and their identifiers. num_topic_words Positive integer.

argument_clauses.name: UniqueId
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
